title: Modeling Electron Energy Loss and Momentum Transfer in a Swift Electron Interaction with Small Polyhedral Nanoparticles
content: Electron microscopy techniques have significantly advanced research in various fields, including Electron Energy-Loss Spectroscopy (EELS) and Cathodoluminescence [1]. These methods facilitate the study of material properties at the nanoscale. Electron microscopy have also led to the development of innovative tools like electron tweezers, which offer potential for precise nanomanipulation and assembly [2]. Additionally, recent advancements in electron microscopy, such as 4D-EELS, provide unprecedented capabilities for atomic-scale characterization. This technique offers detailed insights into electronic and vibrational properties, enabling the study of nanoscale phenomena and locally inhomogeneous scattering processes [3].
